column4: I'm having the worst day ever. I just ran photoRec on a external harddrive from my ubuntu 10.04 and something is seriously wrong. I did a restart and the OS itself can't can't mount dbs1 on the splash screen? I tried safe mode and it says gnome power configurations have been installed incorrectly with it still not booting.
sounds like the recovered data is still bad
no i can't log in as another user.
that wasn't aimed at you
oh sorry my mistake.
only text that is prefixed with your name is aimed at you
restore from backups, if the data is important it will be backed up
When you say backup do oyu mean the previous listing from grub or a actual backup i made myself?
backups you made yourself of the important data
.... it just got worst.

I didn't have any place to backup to so i never backed up as you can clearly see my external harddrive was not a good place to begin with in fact it is so screwed up it has now some how killed my linux OS.
then its not very miportant data, drives fail all the time, its not a matter of if, it's a matter of when. So storing "important data" in a single location is not wise

you can use foremost to read the data and extract it to a healthy partition, the recovered data consistancy is in no way guarunteed, it may have gaps or be garbaged, but you can then reinstall and then put the data back on it
if you had backups you could just wipe the disk, reinstall and restore. But you learned the value of this the hard way

I don't need the backup preaching it is a bad situation all around. I was trying to fix my external so i could store stuff on it when i nfact i have now created the very problem i was trying to avoid.
its in theUbuntu repo so is supported if you use Ubuntu
supported here, that is
No I have it installed. I want some help in figuring out exactly what the log is reporting.
well you can ignore the 'ok' lines, if you pastebin the rest we may be able to comment
Okay I have it ready. http://pastebin.com/cxxCE0a9
Is it looking pretty bad or are most of those nothing to worry about?
I'm not conversant with the app, sorry
